messages.body:
Dear Eliza,
I recieved your message and may i firstly show my appreciation for your willingness to do business with me.I want us to work together to have these funds released in your name as next of kin to the late account holder. Let me reassure you that this business is 100% free. and I am sure that you are going to be happy with me very shortly.  
However,I brought this business to you in view of creating everlasting business relationship. 
Getting this money into your account is not a problem but the safety of my share when it get to your nonminated account till i come to your country. All i need from for you is to follow my instruction till the money is transfer to your account.  
You may required to come my office here and sign some document so that you can see things yourself. It will also help buid trust between to parties and You will see that I am man of my word.
As you can see this business requires a capable and honest person to handle, I hope you have these qualities.If i am not sure of this business i would not have been wasting my time and money on communicating you. I will supply you with my full identification and get necessary documents for release of these funds in your name, but i need more personal information from you to enable get some required document in your name.
Your full names and address?
Your age and marital status?
your occupation and position?
Your Phone and fax numbers?
Your Religion?
Your Country?
Investment information?
Best Regards
Mr Benson Briggs
messages.raw:
But first - a bunch of questions.

Benson Briggs

messages.body:
Dear Mr Briggs,
I'm not sure where to start with this. 
You're talking about an "everlasting business relationship" yet my part in this business was, as far as I could tell, to arrange the transfer of funds. You said nothing about further business. 
However, we can work this out, I guess.
Your full names and address?
Elizabeth Danielle Dane
35 Westmoreland Grove, Glebe, Sydney
Your age and marital status? 22 years old, single
Your occupation and position? Student of botanical science 
Your Phone and fax numbers? (02) 9649 3589
Please note that this number is shared with my family and is not a secure line if confidentiality is needed. My sister Sophie is also the most likely person to answer it. The phone is also locked out of international numbers so I cannot call you on it.
No fax
Your Religion?
Why do you need this? Is there a religion test for jobs in your country, wherever it is?
Your Country?
Australia
Investment information?
I don't understand the question.
Regards,
Eliza Dane

messages.body:
Dear Eliza 
Thanks for your mail and your contact informations , I am happy that we can work in mutual understanding .There is nothing to fear in this business all you have to do is to follow my instructions till you get this money into your account. I will like you to include your account number where this fund will be transfered, i will also like to have a copy of your international passport or your recent photograph.
There is nothing to fear in this business, As soon as this money get in to your account in your country and will come over for my share, and we are going to share this way, 30% and 65%  you will get 30% and i will get 65% and 5% percent will be set aside for expences. The money will come bit by bit in your nominated account. I am sure you will be happy with me very shortly.
As soon as you send your account information, I will give you contact of an attorney that will represent you here till the money get to your account, and get some legal document in your name and you may require to come to my office here to sign some document so that you can see things yourself and it will build more trust to the two parties.
This business is strictly confidential till you get this money into your account, Just because of the confidentiality of this business, I will not call your family phone, all our correspondence will be on this email till we get this money into your account.
What I mean by Investment information? is that do u have any investment idea where we can invest the fund when we get it into your account? I am afraid as a student can you to handle this business, because it may require some little financial support.
Religion matters alot in this business, I cant do this business with somebody that dozent know God for the safety of my share when it get to your account.    
You can call me with my private number +234 80 388 47 221 for more discussion.  (Private and and Anytime) 
Please endavour to reply as soon as you get my mail so that we can conclude as soon as possible. These business is extimated to be completed in next 8 to 9 working days.    
I am waiting for your reply.
Regards
Benson
messages.raw:
Well, few surprises here. He wants Eliza's passport (or a photo, failing that), and there's going to be a lawyer. Of course, who else is going to charge huge fees? At least he accepted the bit about no phone calls.

Benson Briggs

messages.body:
Dear Mr Briggs,
I can't supply a copy of my passport - when I got mine in 2002 the Department had me sign a form stating that I'd safeguard my passport. One thing they definitely warned about was making scans or copies. I can supply a photo taken late last year (New Year's Eve, to be exact).
On the share front - what's with the expenses bit? 5% of 18 million is $900,000 - what could cost that much? Those are the bank charges from Hel!
Investment info? Don't you have a business council in - where the bloody Hel are you? You haven't said - "you may require to come to my office here to sign some document" - where? 
Anyhoo - there must be Web resources you can use to establish the best investment risks. And what's this about "financial support"? You want to spell it out?
I'll be totally frank with you on the religion front - though it shouldn't matter; I am a member of the People of Odin, worshippers of the Norse pantheon as worshipped by the Aryan volk of Europe. I am not a Christian. If this offends you, I am sorry, but you insisted on knowing.
Regards,
Eliza Dane
messages.raw:
OK - order of business:
[1] No passport.
[2] Drop in a reference to the new tourism ad.
[3] Eliza the Goth is the one for this scam. Let's see if it's a problem.
[4] A picture of Sophie Monk - that should get him on side.

Eliza Dane

Regards,
Eliza Dane

messages.body:
Dear Mr Lisa,
Duly noted, but I'm surprised at two things.
 The fees for paperwork look absurdly high. I might consider paying thousands for a document if it was the Magna Carta or the Declaration of Independence, or it had to be secured from a bank vault in Sadr City or somewhere like that. What you're going to get doesn't fall into either category.
 Why on earth would you and your firm be entitled to 5% of the money? You're charging over $11,000 for some papers, and as well you expect to get $900,000 for (your figures) seven days' work? This doesn't make any sense. 
I will be communicating further in the near future.
Regards,
Eliza Dane

messages.body:
You pretty much answered my question - yes, Mr Liza does want payment in advance, so you have to scrape up cash and borrow from your friends, and presumably so do I.
This is just wrong. 
Why is he asking for money up front? My family's had two dealings with lawyers (probate and business matters) and in both cases the fees were paid when the work was done. Doctors, tradesmen, plant suppliers... all of them submit an invoice when the job is done, not before. For some reason, Mr Lisa wants it now. I'm suspicious, I don't quite know why, but I am.
As for his demand for 5%, that is just out of the question. This is a one-off deal, not the OJ trial. He has to get some papers (for which we're paying through the nose) and there's also a fee of $4,000. Over the rate I'd say, but I'll pass that for now. He is smoothing the path for us, and this is worth $900,000? No way!
You say, we're getting 18 million, let it go. Well, I don't like someone taking advantage of me.
Now, coming to your office... are you in Nigeria too? I never hear anything good about it. Riots, street crime, and corruption; is it safe?
Eliza

messages.body:
Benson,
I'm not trying to be difficult; I'm just following my instincts. Father Odin gives wisdom to his people, and I would be wrong to ignore my inner voice that counsels caution.
Still - if you can guarantee this deal, I guess I'll get down to business and ask Mr Lisa if your payment suggestion would work, at least some of the way. I'm not that flush with cash and I'd be hard pressed to cover even half the fee he's charging. If he didn't insist on cash up front I'd be a bit happier about things.
I guess I spoke a bit out of line about Nigeria. It's a negative overload thing - bad things make the papers, good things don't. I looked up Nigeria on travel guides and there seem to be things worth seeing. I really like the look of Sungbo Eredo. Do you know it?

Benson,
I'm not trying to be difficult; I'm just following my instincts. Father Odin gives wisdom to his people, and I would be wrong to ignore my inner voice that counsels caution.
Still - if you can guarantee this deal, I guess I'll get down to business and ask Mr Lisa if your payment suggestion would work, at least some of the way. I guess I spoke a bit out of line about Nigeria. It's a negative overload thing - bad things make the papers, good things don't. I looked up Nigeria on travel guides and there seem to be things worth seeing. I really like the look of Sungbo Eredo. Do you know it?
Bye for now,
Eliza
PS Where the Hel is your photo!?
